DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Blinatumomab works by bringing healthy T cells (immune cells that help kill cancer cells) and leukemia cells close together so the T cells can more effectively kill the leukemia cells. It does this by binding to a protein called CD3 on healthy T cells and a protein called CD19 on B cells (the immune cells that are cancerous in acute lymphoblastic leukemia). Blinatumomab is a type of immunotherapy drug called a bispecific T-cell engager (BiTE).

Section.Title: Use in Cancer

ItemizedList.ListItem: B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia that is CD19 positive in adults and children aged 1 month and older. It is used:in certain patients with cancer that is in the first or second complete remissionin patients with cancer that has come back or did not respond to treatmentin certain patients with cancer that does not have the Philadelphia chromosome and who are in the consolidation phase of chemotherapy

Section.Para: Blinatumomab is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
